messages.message:
Hi All, couple of questions RE our Docker images:
1. Is our repo publicly hosted or do we host ourselves?
2. When we ship images directly to the customer how do we do this?
Thanks in advance for the help!

1. images are hosted in gcr, they are private
2. We tag all our containers and upload them to gcr. We create a read-only service account for each customers to use so that they can access our gcr and pull newly built images.
We also have an AWS repository for customers who run on there; it's also private and we grant customers' AWS projects read-only access to it.
Can we also ship images directly to the customer?
Whatâ€™s the use case for that? Usually they would use the key we give them to pull images from our repository then they can push it to their own.
@Matt Weaver mentioned it was a possibility. Just giving the client all available options so they can choose what works best

Ah yes, so I believe we're using this option for natwest since they're setting up instabase in a VM. Most customers would be able to pull from our repositories either directly or indirectly and sending directly each time is the hardest to maintain since the images are ~30gb in size. But, it is an option if a customer requires it.
Ah thanks. How would we transfer images of that size? Guessing not via email :wink:
I'm not sure what the best way is, maybe putting it on AWS in an S3 bucket? Or if the customer has some FTP set up that we can upload to?
They seem happy to use AWS repository. When the time is right who is the right person to provision them access please?
Great, will loop you in when ready. Thanks Kunal!
